location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from George Lucas, Muskat [Muscat] to Lewis Pelly, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire

mods.abstract: Letter regarding the settlement of matters in Muskat [Muscat] and the rumours of the death of Ranshid ben Omain, believed to have been an accomplice of Sayed Soulem [Salim II bin Thuwaini] in the murder of his father (Thuwaini bin Said).The letter goes on to discuss rumous of a possible conspiracy against Sayed Soulem by his friends and Sayed Torkee [Turki bin Said]'s attempts to get to Muskat by sea.The letter also refers to two enclosures which are no longer with this letter. Firstly a letter from Bombay which was found in the Muskat mail bag, and secondly a copy of Pelly's instructions to Lieutenant Edwin Dawes.
